comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0a1) Gecko/20110531 Firefox/7.0a1

On the given browser size the fifth invocation of zoom out increases the displayed image size.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open url
2. press ctrl-dash repeatedly
3.

Actual Results:  
Displayed image size is increased after fifth invocation of "zoom out".

Expected Results:  
Monotonically decreasing displayed image size.

FF 3.5, 3.6 are OK. Error reproduced in FF 4,5 and 7.
Issue reproducible at least since 2011-01-05-03-mozilla-central.

comments.raw_text: Perhaps that bug was marked duplicate too quickly. I think the issue in this bug might be different (although related).
comments.text: Perhaps that bug was marked duplicate too quickly. I think the issue in this bug might be different (although related).

I can see the problem on the provided URL (at fifth zoom step) but also on http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2301433/Screenshots/DailyNullNull.png. That one jump to bigger size at third zoom step. The images have in common that they both are bigger than the available space in the window. So their initial display is already resized down. You can see that with the mouse cursor changing to magnifying glass with a plus sign. If the image is clicked to full size, then further zooms out with key shorcuts do not show the problem.
comments.creator: acelists@atlas.sk
